text: Henry II (June 1270 â€“ 31 March 1324) was the last crowned King of Jerusalem and the King of Cyprus During his reign, the Mamluks conquered the majority of the Kingdom of Jerusalem with the city of Acre Henry was forced into exile in Cyprus, reigning over the rump state of Cyprus until his death in 1324. Category:Cypriot people Category:1285 births Category:1324 deaths Category:People from Jerusalem Category:Kings and queens
title: Henry II of Cyprus
